name: Around Tennoji

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Heading from Sakai City station to Tennoji station on a Monday morning.  See, trains in Japan aren't always packed.  Well, it's a holiday morning, it's still early, and this is the local (milk run) train, not the express.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Arrival at Tennoji station.  All the subsequent pics in this album were taken within five minutes walk of the station.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Common train station kiosk, selling bento boxes and decent homestyle foods for eating on the train (and also the standard fare: canned drinks, etc.).

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: This was a working day for me, and I move from cafe to cafe with my laptop.  I started at, horror of horrors, Starbucks.  Why?  Well, it's actually a bit of a fun scene.  And it's non-smoking.  I was here for two hours.  A regular hangout for me, I admit.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Cafe number two.  This is a little teahouse/cafe just around the corner from the station.  This is a Western-themed place with nice lunch plates and a good air conditioner.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Walking around the backstreets around Tennoji station.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Tempting little eating/drinking place tucked away on a quiet residential street.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Some modest older-style houses behind the station.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Residential side street.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Japanese garbage truck and a fancy-looking entrance to a not-so-fancy residence.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Little alley... working my way back to a main street.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Almost back at the main street... a quaint little Western-style beauty parlour.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Another shot of the beauty parlour.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: At the main street, facing away from the station...

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Now walking back towards the station... about a three-block walk.  Usually this sidewalk is packed and quite dangerous (esp. with our double-wide stroller) with all the bicycles, but it's quiet today.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Colonel Saunders and a favourite coffee shop sign at the top of the pic.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Inside my favourite "kiisaten" (coffee shop) near Tennoji station.  Another two-hour session here.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Back in the alleys behind the station.  This is a (relatively modest) "love hotel".  Rooms by the hour, discreet parking, and cool themes (one of these love hotels in another district is called "Broccoli").

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: In behind the station, just walking around.  Some drinking places here and another little hotel.  Lots of closed shops.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Tommy Lee Jones advertising canned coffee (it's almost like a public service ad... "drink coffee and you'll end up looking like me").

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Drinking and karaoke places heading back to the main street again.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Back on the main street.  Closeup of some signage outside a big building.  "ECC" is a huge English language school chain.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Just a cute sign.  "Tanaka" is like the "Smith" or "Jones" of Japan.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Back at the kinda high-endish shopping building (called "Hoop") near Starbucks.  Some very high-end stores... this general area (Tennoji) is more mixed, though... not really known as an expensive area.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: In the underground shopping area in the station itself.  A typical coffee/parfait parlour.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: In the gourmet food section of the Kintetsu department store attached to the station.  I added a video of this to YouTube... look for user "karaokeyoga".

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: The guy in the white/red shirt is looking at some kind of "Kiss" band item.

photos.title: Around Tennoji
photos.description: Where I had my dinner... and what I had, too (upper right... tonkatsu (breaded pork cutlet) curry... end of my Tennoji day!

cover_photo.title: Around Tennoji
cover_photo.description: Heading from Sakai City station to Tennoji station on a Monday morning.  See, trains in Japan aren't always packed.  Well, it's a holiday morning, it's still early, and this is the local (milk run) train, not the express.

description: Various pics taken within a few minutes walk of Tennoji Station, a big transfer point in the south of Osaka, Japan.
